article.headline: Fresno St. 72, Idaho 70, OT
article.story: MOSCOW, Idaho (AP) -- Dominic McGuire had 21 points, 14 rebounds and seven assists in Fresno State's 72-70 overtime win over Idaho Saturday night. Quinton Hosley added 14 points and 14 rebounds for the Bulldogs (16-7, 5-5 Western Athletic Conference). Trevor Morris, starting in place of Idaho scoring leader Keoni Watson, led the Vandals (3-19, 1-9) with 16 points. Michael Crowell scored 15 points for Idaho, and David Jackson had 14 points and eight rebounds in Idaho's fifth straight loss. Idaho coach George Pfeifer said he did not play leading scorer Keoni Watson for academic reasons. Watson ranks fourth in the WAC with 17.1 points per game. Pfeifer said he is uncertain if Watson will play in Idaho's next game Wednesday at Boise State. Morris sent the game into overtime when he sank three free throws after being fouled by McGuire on a 3-point attempt with 18.4 seconds left in regulation. McGuire drove the lane and missed the potential game-winning basket as time expired at the end of the second half. JaVance Coleman, who scored nine of his 11 points in overtime, sank his only field goal in seven attempts for a 3-pointer that gave Fresno State the lead for good at 65-62 with 1:40 left in overtime. Coleman converted all eight of his free throws, including two that pushed the Bulldogs ahead 58-55 with 31.3 seconds left in regulation. Fresno State shot just 34 percent from the field, including 22 percent after the first half. Idaho shot 38 percent from the field, including 24 percent after the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
